info.name: github black&red
info.description: style based off of GitHub dark material, the main goal is a full black&red theme. another notable feature is the fact it includes a full-screen editor so you now use all that empty space and have an editor that fits every time.
info.additionalInfo:
13
____
*make code preview full width again
*remove unneeded padding
12
____
*oopsie! apply background, it is needed after all
11
____
*stop applying background to .CodeMirror, it already inherits it.
*give .CodeMirror its own separate selector
*fix editor being higher than visible area
10
____
*issues on front page are not invisible any more
9
____
*when editing issues you now have a dark background rather than one that flickers between grey and white
8
____
*sudo mode authentication now has a dark background
7
____
*code editor once again has a dark background
6
____
*removed !important tags that may or may not be required
*removed white space
*it's now clear again that the compare across forks button is a link
*code comments are now less likely to drain performance
*simplified code
*removed duplicate code
*various elements are now coloured differently thanks to code fixes
*issues links now turn red when hovered
5
____
*fixed white code editor
*removed some uses of !important
*removed some duplicate code
*removed some font styling (deemed unnecessary)
*removed some whitespace
4
____
*removed duplicate background property
*simplified code
*merged identical CSS
*removed code of questionable relevance
3
____
*fixed background being white in some areas
2
____
*code editor is now full width so you can make better use of your whole screen
1
____
*removed erroneous '!important' tags
*darkened background
